5/As minister for Brexit Opportunities and Government Efficiency I want to visit more ports to see how the Government can help make their lives easier as well, as free trade and a freer economy are guarantors of prosperity.
4/The announcement of Freeport East in Felixstowe and Harwich poses a brilliant opportunity for growth, development and innovation, along with many other freeports up and down the country.

3/I want to help the port make it easier to invest in more automation and reduce the bureaucratic hurdles facing its expansion. I want to ensure that any regulation imposed on its business has a clear purpose and benefits the British economy and British consumers.

2/The port has faced challenges recently, such as the strain on global supply chains following the pandemic. These have been eased thanks to technological innovations in the port and regulatory changes made by the Government but there is still more to do.

1/I had the pleasure of visiting the Port of Felixstowe this week. It is a magnificent operation to witness in person. As a maritime nation, ports like this play a vital role in our economy and also tell a fascinating story about our history. https://t.co/9QFnIuQUfy
